item.title: 56-3-3 Program 2003-39
item.description: BK 56-3-3 Program 2003-39. John is emphasizing the "doing" part. Now, everything pertaining to Israel is legalism. It's works. Of course, it's always based on faith. Never leave faith out of the mix, but for Israel, it was faith and works.
item.itunes:title: 56-3-3 Program 2003-39
item.itunes:author: Les Feldick
item.itunes:subtitle: BK 56-3-3 Program 2003-39. John is emphasizing the "doing" part. Now, everything pertaining to Israel is legalism. It's works. Of course, it's always based on faith. Never leave faith out of the mix, but for Israel, it was faith and works.

item.content:encoded: BK 56-3-3 Program 2003-39. John is emphasizing the "doing" part. Now, everything pertaining to Israel is legalism. It's works. Of course, it's always based on faith. Never leave faith out of the mix, but for Israel, it was faith and works.

item.title: 56-3-2 Program 2003-38
item.description: BK 56-3-2 Program 2003-38 We certainly don't teach that we can reach a position of sinlessness. We all sin every day. But, I'm going to be showing that now, in these succeeding verses, that Divine nature that comes in as a result of our salvation cannot sin.

Feldick is starting this lesson with 1 Timothy 6:1 and a lot of you are going to say Why did you skip chapter 5? Feldick is starting this lesson with 1 Timothy 6:1 and a lot of you are going to say Why did you skip chapter 5? item.description: Bk 15-2-3 Program 0794. In this episode of Through the Bible, Les teaches on how we don't dismiss Jesus' parables, as there are great moral lessons found there that we can apply today. But in the flow of Scripture, you must realize that this is all part and parcel of God dealing with the Nation of Israel under those covenants and promises He made in the Old Testament.

item.title: 15-3-1 Program 0994
item.description: Bk 15-3-1 Program 0994. In this episode of Through the Bible, Les turns to Matthew 23. We have more or less been taking an overview, and pointing out that in Christ's earthly ministry there is nothing of the Body of Christ, the Church, in the four Gospels. There is no Church language in here. This is all Christ dealing under the Law, with the Jew under the Law.
